metadata.sermon_title: God’s Alien Work in the Church—Isaiah 28:14-22
metadata.notes: Delivered at Wycliffe College (2003) during a period of intense denominational division regarding sexuality and orthodoxy.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher utilizes the 'Voice of the Prophet' which is a classic CP manifestation. The language of 'destruction,' 'wrath,' and 'scoffers' serves to establish a moral hierarchy. However, the CP is directed more at the 'institution' than the individual listener's private life.
quotes: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you scoffers
Destruction is decreed, overflowing with righteousness
Lest your bonds be made strong

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The Nurturing Parent appears in the conclusion, offering comfort ('Beloved of God') and reassurance. It avoids 'smothering' by acknowledging the difficulty of the situation rather than offering a cheap fix.
quotes: May you always be strengthened and comforted by the knowledge
When we cannot see God’s hand, we trust his heart

adult.analysis: The preacher engages in significant Adult-to-Adult data processing by citing historical figures (Lincoln), theologians (Luther), and current events. He invites the audience to 'grapple' with complex ideas rather than just obey.
quotes: Increased attention has been given lately to the subject of Abraham Lincoln as a theological thinker.
In great contests each party claims to act in accordance with the will of God. Both may be, and one must be wrong.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher speaks from a position of 'troubled' concern, which borders on the AC's anxiety, but he also pushes the congregation into an AC role by emphasizing 'sheer terror' and the 'overwhelming scourge.'
quotes: It will be sheer terror to understand the message
I am troubled (as you are) about the divisions within the church

free_child_FC.analysis: There is very little FC spontaneity or joy. The tone is somber and heavy, typical of the 'Advent' theme of judgment. The only hint of FC is the 'authentic humility' mentioned in the anecdote.
quotes: It was one of the most authentically humble confessions I have heard

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher primarily occupies the role of the Wise/Critical Parent instructing the 'students' (Adapted Children) on the reality of judgment. However, there is a strong Adult-Adult current where he treats the listeners as intellectual peers capable of handling Lincoln and Luther.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: The social level is an academic lecture on Isaiah; the psychological level is a warning to 'stay in line' during denominational conflict.
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'double bottom' lies in the use of 'humility.' While preaching humility, the preacher reinforces a specific 'Evangelical' identity as the one being 'disdained,' which can foster a secret sense of superiority (The 'I'm more humble than the liberals' trap).

detected_games.name: Ain't It Awful

formula_g_analysis.con: The church is in crisis and the world is polarized.
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's anxiety about their future careers/church stability.
formula_g_analysis.switch: Moving from 'we are all in trouble' to 'God is actually the one doing the destroying.'
formula_g_analysis.payoff: A shared sense of tragic importance and 'righteous' suffering.

evidence_quotes: The shouting and name-calling on television, the self-righteous attitudes in the church... all of this is alarming.

detected_games.name: Bait & Switch (Redemption)

formula_g_analysis.con: Advent is about the coming of Christ (the cornerstone).
formula_g_analysis.switch: The cornerstone is actually a 'stumbling block' and God is using his 'left hand' to strike you.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The listener feels small and dependent on the preacher's interpretation of 'strange' events.

evidence_quotes: The coming of Christ divides... it continues to cause a crisis now.
It is better to be struck by the left hand of God than to think that God has no plan.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: Authenticity is maintained through the preacher's admission of his own 'troubled' state and the inclusion of the Lincoln quote which admits that 'both sides may be wrong,' which disrupts the standard 'I'm Right/You're Wrong' game.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Moderate: Offers the 'foundation stone' and the 'theology of Luther' as the only way to survive the 'scourge.'
preacher_roles.persecutor: Moderate: Uses the text of Isaiah to warn 'scoffers' and those with 'refuges of lies.'
preacher_roles.victim: Low: Briefly identifies with the 'disdained' evangelical community.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: Victim: The congregation is portrayed as being 'buffeted' by God's 'alien work' and 'overwhelmed.'
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers an escape through the 'Adult' ego state—encouraging listeners to 'grapple' and 'trust' based on a historical/theological framework rather than blind emotional reaction.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: The sermon is psychologically complex. It avoids the 'I'm Only Trying to Help You' trap by refusing to offer easy solutions to the church's crisis. However, it leans heavily on the Critical Parent to establish authority, using 'God's wrath' as a tool to induce a state of Adapted Child compliance/fear in the listeners. The use of Lincoln provides a healthy Adult 'reality check' that prevents the sermon from becoming a pure 'NIGYSOB' game against theological opponents.
strengths: Strong Adult ego engagement through historical and intellectual rigor.
Honest admission of the preacher's own emotional state (Adult transparency).
areas_for_improvement: High reliance on 'Fear' (CP) as a motivational tool.
The 'Alien Work' concept can be used to justify any hardship, potentially keeping listeners in a 'Victim' role.
Lack of 'Free Child' joy or hope.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: To move toward game-free communication, the preacher could invite more FC spontaneity by focusing on the 'new thing' God is creating, rather than just the 'destruction' He is decreeing. Reducing the 'Ain't it Awful' framing of the church's state would also empower the listeners' Adult ego.
